intro: Atylosia geminiflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces two small, yellow flowers that are borne on opposite sides of the stem, giving it its common name. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in arid and rocky environments. Atylosia geminiflora is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and along canyon walls.
